dcterms:creator: A. Santoro
S. Bartunov
M. Botvinick
D. Wierstra
T. Lillicrap
dcterms:description: The Omniglot dataset consists of 1623 characters from 50 different alphabets, with 20 samples per class. It is ideal for one-shot learning due to its large number of classes and relatively few samples per class.
dcterms:title: Omniglot

dcterms:creator: A. Santoro
S. Bartunov
M. Botvinick
D. Wierstra
T. Lillicrap
dcterms:description: The MNIST dataset consists of handwritten digits and is commonly used for training various image processing systems. In this paper, it was used for zero-shot learning after training on the Omniglot dataset.
dcterms:title: MNIST

dcterms:creator: A. Santoro
S. Bartunov
M. Botvinick
D. Wierstra
T. Lillicrap
dcterms:description: The miniMNIST dataset is a subset of the MNIST dataset, containing only 20 image samples per class, which are randomly selected from the original MNIST dataset. It was used for testing the model's performance after training on the Omniglot dataset.
dcterms:title: miniMNIST
